poem:
"Harvest of Solitude"

On Dads Lane, a sliver of green,
Emerald echo in the city's machine,
Undistinguished haven, unseen,
A secret garden, untamed, serene.
Man tills soil, as clocks convene,
In the pulse of Birmingham's morning sheen.
Where courgettes grow deep and keen,
Becoming blood, becoming skin,
Bearing love etched within.
In this humble eden, no sin,
Only stories of nature, silently spin.
